head.title: National Briefing | New England: Massachusetts: Commuter Train Kills 2 Workers

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | New England: Massachusetts: Commuter Train Kills 2 Workers

abstract.p: Two track workers are killed and four are injured when commuter train plows into track maintenance equipment while heading to Boston from Lowell, carrying 43 passengers; several passengers are taken to hospital for minor injuries; Massachusetts Bay Commuter Rail says crew was performing routine track maintenance work (S)

block.p: Two track workers were killed, and four were injured when a commuter train plowed into track maintenance equipment. The train, with 43 passengers, was headed to Boston from Lowell when it hit the equipment shortly before 2 p.m. Ten passengers were taken to hospitals with minor injuries, and no crew members were hurt. Scott Farmelant, a spokesman for Massachusetts Bay Commuter Rail, said the crew was performing routine track maintenance work.
